text: Robert McCredie May, Baron May of Oxford, HonFAIB (8 January 1936 - 28 April 2020) was an Australian scientist. He was President of the Royal Society from 2000 to 2005. He is a professor at the University of Sydney and Princeton University. He was a crossbench (independent) member of the House of Lords from 2001 until his retirement in 2017. May was a Fellow of Merton College, Oxford, and an appointed member of the council of the British Science Association. He was also a member of the advisory council for the Campaign for Science and Engineering. He was elected a member of the Academia Europaea in 1994. May died on 28 April 2020 at a nursing home in Oxford of pneumonia caused by Alzheimer's disease, aged 84. ==References== Category:1936 births Category:2020 deaths Category:Australian biologists Category:Australian mathematicians Category:Zoologists Category:Ecologists Category:Members of Academia Europaea Category:People from Sydney
title: Robert May, Baron May of Oxford
